results.title: Whiteys like us
results.creator_credit: Rachel Landers, Tom Zubrycki, SBS Independent and Ronin Films
results.brief_description: In 1991 a National Council for Aboriginal Reconciliation was established in Australia with the “aim of improving relations between Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and other Australians” by the year 2001. To achieve this, Study Circles were set up across Australia whereby small groups of people would come together and debate the issues over a period of eight weeks and since 1991 over 1500 Study Circles have been held throughout Australia. This documentary focuses on one such study circle which took place at the Manly Community College in 1998 where all the participants were non-indigenous Australians from Sydney’s affluent north shore. The dynamics of the group and the responses of the individuals within it reveal a lot about the current and complex state of indigenous and non-indigenous relations in Australia. The emotions expressed by the group are quite confronting particularly when David Watts (Indigenous Heritage Officer) appears as a guest speaker at one of the weekly sessions. This is a most compelling documentary on the issue of reconciliation revealing the personal struggles it would seem that most “ordinary” Australians are attempting to come to terms with.

results.title: Whitewater...and the winning combination
results.brief_description: The film uses a champion kayaker facing the rapids of the Colorado River to show how an individual must find his own winning combination to face the challenge and succeed in any field. A motivational film.

results.title: Whitewashed (A)
results.creator_credit: Sue Ross and New South Wales Institute of Technology

results.title: White zombie
results.creator_credit: Victor Halperin and Edward C. Halperin
results.brief_description: In this eerie, theatrically staged horror film, a young couple, Madeleine Short (Madge Bellamy) and Neil Parker (John Harron) encounter the world of voodoo and zombies in the Haitian mountains when they arrive as guests of Charles Beaumont (Robert Fraser). When their host enlists the evil powers of Muder Legende (Bela Lugosi) to place a curse on Madeleine, a series of chilling events occur.

results.title: White sails in Danish waters
results.creator_credit: Carl Otto Peterson, Paul Bang and Nordisk Films Kompagni
results.brief_description: Shows yachting in Danish waters. Tells how children and young people receive skilled instruction in the yacht clubs. We join a holiday cruise through some of Denmark’s loveliest regions, and experience a race on the sound.

results.title: White safari
results.creator_credit: Hugh Wallace, Sydney Newman and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Canada carries on”.
This is an abridged version of the film Exercise Musk-ox. It describes a three-month journey of scientific exploration through Canada’s north. Members of the Canadian Army, with snowmobiles and amphibious weasel, made a great winter trek over country never before travelled by motor vehicle. The expedition took detailed weather observations, corrected maps, studied the mobility of snow vehicles, and coped with the weather. Through human skill and endurance the frontier of the north was pushed back, showing its rich promise for the future. Voice and narration: Lorne Greene.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Hugh Wallace, Sydney Newman and National Film Board of Canada
